page_analysis.text_content:
Recessed porches on the 1st floor

Recessed porches on the ground floor do NOT count toward gross floor area if ALL the following criteria apply:
• Depth of porch is less than 10' and,
• Porch ceiling is below 2nd floor and,
• Exterior side is substantially open.

Fig 9 Recessed porches on the 1st floor

A This example complies with all three criteria and does NOT count toward gross floor area

B This example violates two of the three criteria;
• the porch depth is greater than 10' and
• the porch ceiling is above the 2nd floor
Therefore it DOES count toward gross floor area and if it is higher than 17' it will count twice (see note).

Note: It is the city's policy to consider one-story construction to be construction less than 17' above finished floor. If the porch space is higher, the area will count again as 2nd story equivalency.

visual_elements.description: Two isometric architectural illustrations of a house showing recessed porches on the 1st floor. The left illustration (labeled A) shows a porch with depth less than 10 feet, porch ceiling below the 2nd floor line, and substantially open exterior side, indicating compliance with all three criteria and that it does NOT count toward gross floor area. The right illustration (labeled B) shows a porch with depth greater than 10 feet and porch ceiling above the 2nd floor line, indicating violation of two criteria and that it DOES count toward gross floor area and may count twice if higher than 17 feet. Both illustrations have annotations pointing to the '2nd floor line', 'Porch ceiling below 2nd floor' (left), 'Height extends past 2nd floor line' (right), and porch depth measurements.
visual_elements.location: Bottom half of the page, left and right sides respectively

visual_elements.description: A shaded note box stating the city's policy on one-story construction: "It is the city's policy to consider one-story construction to be construction less than 17' above finished floor. If the porch space is higher, the area will count again as 2nd story equivalency."
visual_elements.location: Upper right quadrant of the page

additional_notes: Page number 14 at bottom left corner.
No handwritten annotations or stamps detected.
Text and images are clear and legible.
cross_references: Reference to 'see note' regarding counting area twice if porch space is higher than 17'.

qualifiers.text: Recessed porches on the ground floor do NOT count toward gross floor area if ALL the following criteria apply:

conditions.text: Depth of porch is less than 10'
Porch ceiling is above the 2nd floor
Porch space is higher than 17' above finished floor

logical_relationships.expression: Depth of porch is less than 10' AND Porch ceiling is below 2nd floor AND Exterior side is substantially open
IF porch depth is greater than 10' OR porch ceiling is above the 2nd floor THEN porch counts toward gross floor area
logical_relationships.ambiguity_note: Logical OR is inferred from text 'violates two of the three criteria' but not explicitly stated.

logical_relationships.expression: IF porch space is higher than 17' above finished floor THEN area counts again as 2nd story equivalency

execution_sequence.action: Evaluate if all three criteria (c1, c2, c3) are met to exclude porch from gross floor area
If any of the criteria (c1 or c2) are violated, count porch toward gross floor area
If porch height exceeds 17 feet, count area again as 2nd story equivalency
